title: Bug 12906 - Unable to open file in another editor when already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, there is no warning or error message when attempting to open the same file in another editor.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message indicating that the file is already opened and cannot be opened in another editor.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or Wordpad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
5. Nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message stating that you cannot open the file in another editor and to close all existing files first.
